title: Philips and sustainability at COP28 - News - Philips
summary: Philips has made steps to embed sustainability and climate action in healthcare delivery. The company has turned its sights on partnering to reduce its Scope 3 emissions to ensure end-to-end value chain sustainability. Philips became the first health technology company to have its entire value-chain CO2 emissions reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi).
green_innovation: TRUE, Philips' efforts to drive sustainable healthcare are based on energy efficiency, resource efficiency, and care pathway optimization.
business_innovation: TRUE, Philips is providing practical help to customers and suppliers to reduce their carbon footprint and improve sustainability.
green_product: TRUE, Philips is co-creating new digital and circular health solutions that reduce healthcare’s carbon footprint and enable the delivery of quality care.
green_process: TRUE, Philips is building new partnerships for renewable electricity and working with suppliers to reduce the environmental impact of their products and services.
product_or_process: Philips' efforts to drive sustainable healthcare are based on energy efficiency, resource efficiency, and care pathway optimization.

greenwashing: There is no evidence of greenwashing in the article.

title: Apple 'Scary Fast' Mac Event: Revving Up the Tech World - Daily Investor Hub
summary: Apple recently held its "Scary Fast" Mac event, where it unveiled its latest lineup of Mac products, including the M3-equipped iMac, 14- and 16-inch MacBook Pro models with M3 Pro and M3 Max chips, and more. The event showcased several new products and features that are sure to excite Apple fans. Apple’s transition to its own custom-designed silicon has been in the works for several years, and the ‘Scary Fast’ event showcased the latest advancements in this area.
product_or_process: M3 chip, M3 Pro, M3 Max, iMac, MacBook Pro, macOS Monterey
